H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H6685.def: = action by which someone abstains from eating food, sometimes accompanied by mourning, prayer, and sacrifices, ◄ as a result of grief, repentance, or done as part of a ritual; ► its primary intention is to humble oneself before God and so be pleasing to him

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H914.def: = action by which part of an entity is separated from the rest, either by detaching it completely it or by creating a kind of barrier (visible or invisible) between the selected part and the rest of the entity

H5236.def: = state in which something is associated with a nation or country that is different from one's own

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H5977.def: literally: standing; hence: = a place where humans stand, either by choice or by assignment

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7243.def: = state in which a countable entity is the fourth in a range

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H7812.def: = to lay oneself down on the ground ► as a sign of submission

H3881.def: = man and tribe; ◄ third son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, later responsible for temple duties

H3442.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► family head in charge of a division of {L:priests<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; time of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H6934.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► family head; returned from {L:Babylonian<SDBH:בָּבֶל>} exile under {L:Zerubbabel<SDBH:זְרֻבָּבֶל>}; supervised those rebuilding the temple; in charge of worship after exile

H3662.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► Levite; after exile

H4608.def: = a raised level surface ► on which people can stand

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3442.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► family head in charge of a division of {L:priests<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; time of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H6934.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► family head; returned from {L:Babylonian<SDBH:בָּבֶל>} exile under {L:Zerubbabel<SDBH:זְרֻבָּבֶל>}; supervised those rebuilding the temple; in charge of worship after exile

H1941.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► husband of sister of {L:Naham<SDBH:נַחַם>}

H6611.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► family head in charge of a division of {L:priests<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; time of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H1293.def: = action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H7812.def: = to lay oneself down on the ground ► as a sign of submission

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H87.def: = man, also known as {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>}; ◄ son of {L:Terah<SDBH:תֶּרַח>}; ► first patriarch of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; father of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>} and {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H3778.def: exact meaning unknown; = class of persons skilled in magic and soothsaying; ◄ found in {L:Babylon<SDBH:בָּבֶל>}

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3669.def: = descendant of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}, son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}, son of {L:Noah<SDBH:נֹחַ>} and inhabitant of the country named after them

H2850.def: = member of ethnic group inhabiting {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>} before arrival of {L:Israelites<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ◄ regarded as descendants of {L:Heth<SDBH:חֵת>}

H567.def: = member of ethnic group; ◄ original inhabitants of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}

H6522.def: = member of ethnic group; ◄ original inhabitants of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H2201.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H5488.def: meaning unsure; probably: = a reed-like plant, which grows in water and reaches a height of up to 3 m high; its fuzzy brown seed head becomes fluffy and blows away in the wind; ◄ Typha genus; ► used for baskets and mats; its roots are edible

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H226.def: = an object that represents and identifies a group of people; in the form of a flag or a metal or wooden board, often with an image; attached to a pole so that it can be carried; used in both military and religious contexts

H4159.def: = object or event that reminds of something that has happened or as a confirmation of something that is yet to happen

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2102.def: = process by which a food substance is caused to be cooked; ◄ by heating it in a pan with water for a prolonged time ► in order to make it ready, or more palatable, for human consumption

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H4688.def: = a very low area of the earth

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H5794.def: = state in which a person, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H5982.def: = a tall, vertical structure ◄ made of metal, stone, or wood ► and used as support for a building or for decoration

H6051.def: = a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H215.def: = process by which something reflects light; ≈ associated with well-being

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5514.def: = mountain and surrounding desert on the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, also known as Mount {L:Horeb<SDBH:חֹורֵב>}; ► location where {L:YHWH<SDBH:יהוה>} entered into a {L:covenant<SDBH:בְּרִית>} with {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H7676.def: = the seventh day of the week, which is a day of rest during which the people are not to do any work

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H6772.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5659.def: = state in which one is a slave or treated as such

H4805.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of someone to which they had formerly been subjected

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2587.def: = state in which deities are favorably disposed to someone, or of experiencing an emotion of compassion towards other people, and acting accordingly

H7349.def: = state in which deities feel compassion for humans, ► which is usually translated into action

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H4541.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H5695.def: = male young of a {L:cow<SDBH:פָּרָה>}; ► used as a symbol for a deity; also used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with being willful and untrained

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5982.def: = a tall, vertical structure ◄ made of metal, stone, or wood ► and used as support for a building or for decoration

H6051.def: = a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H215.def: = process by which something reflects light; ≈ associated with well-being

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H4513.def: = action by which humans or deities are unwilling to give or sell something to (other) humans

H4478.def: = substance described as falling from heaven to feed the Israelites in the desert, sometimes identified with the honeylike liquid dropping from tamarisk trees; its name is associated with the interrogative pronoun meaning "what (is it)?"

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6772.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H705.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H3557.def: = state in which a container is able to accomodate something within its available space

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H2637.def: = state in which humans or objects are found less in quantity or entirely absent in a location where they are supposed to be present

H8008.def: = a long, flowing outer garment reaching to the feet; it was generally a loose-fitting cloth that was draped around the body and held in place in the middle by a sash wrapped around the waist or some means of fastening such as pins or buttons; it was worn at all levels of society, including also priests and other religious leaders; it served more purposes than just an outer covering; women sometimes carried bowls or other implements or grain in its folds; for poorer people it also served as a covering when sleeping

H1086.def: = process by which objects lose their quality and strength due to continued use; ≈ used figuratively to denote the loss of a person's vitality

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1216.def: = process by which parts of the body become larger or rounder in size, as a result of injury or the accumulation of fluid in the soft tissues

H4467.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H6285.def: = one of the sides or corners of an object

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H2809.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with the purpose of achieving something

H1316.def: = region; ◄ north-east of the River {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}, ► at one time ruled by king {L:Og<SDBH:עֹוג>}, later assigned to half of the tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}

H3556.def: = celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation
= process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3665.def: = action by which humans show a low estimate of their own importance, usually before a deity

H3669.def: = descendant of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}, son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}, son of {L:Noah<SDBH:נֹחַ>} and inhabitant of the country named after them

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H1219.def: = action by which someone picks or harvests grapes from vines

H8082.def: literally: fatling; hence: = a young animal that has been fattened to prepare it for slaughter, either for food or sacrifice

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H2898.def: = state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at

H953.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H2672.def: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H2132.def: = tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈  regarded as beautiful and associated with well-being

H3978.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H8080.def: literally: to be fat; hence: = state in which humans or animals look healthy and strong ◄ as a result of an abundance of food; ≈ it is important to note that fatness is usually regarded as a good quality in the OT, even though the causes and consequences are not necessarily considered positive; sometimes, however, fatness is associated with dullness and unresponsiveness

H5727.def: = to find excessive joy in the things that one does

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H4775.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H1458.def: literally: to throw behind (one's) back; hence: = state in which someone attributes very little value to a person, deity, or institution, as if it were something that is carelessly thrown behind one's back

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5749.def: = action with which a person gives evidence or proof of something, often as a witness in a legal setting ► the witness can be favorable or unfavorable

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3334.def: = causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H7287.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise authority over (other) humans, animals, and areas, often with focus on the manner in which this is done

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H2102.def: = process by which a food substance is caused to be cooked; ◄ by heating it in a pan with water for a prolonged time ► in order to make it ready, or more palatable, for human consumption

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5637.def: = state by which humans or animals stand up to or oppose the authority of a person or ruler or deity

H3802.def: = the joint between each arm and the main part of the human body; ► often used for carrying heavy weights

H7185.def: = process by which humans experience an event as difficult to handle or hard to accept

H4900.def: = state in which humans are of more than average height{N:001}

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2587.def: = state in which deities are favorably disposed to someone, or of experiencing an emotion of compassion towards other people, and acting accordingly

H7349.def: = state in which deities feel compassion for humans, ► which is usually translated into action

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H4591.def: = state in which humans or objects are relatively few in number

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H587.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H1472.def: = the physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or animal, either alive or dead

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H587.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H587.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H2856.def: = to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H3881.def: = man and tribe; ◄ third son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, later responsible for temple duties

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others
